storyInfo: The noble red dragon returns to the castle once more. To win many more futures than her own, she goes to confront the greedy red dragon, to kill her, and yet, to mourn her.

attributes.text: Where did you leave off...? Ah yes, on the eve of Samhain, while the sun still hung in the sky.
Samhain nights bind life with death. This is no mere superstition. Or perhaps you could say it has long transcended superstition.
Taran legends speak of countless great deeds and tragedies occurring on this very night, and such tales often put the date front and center.

So long as innumerable legends coincide on that day, and so long as the Tarans still remember, if only vaguely, to celebrate the harvest and light up fires on that day, it will never be a simple change of season.
It itself is the perfect footnote to add to any myth.
...Oh, and another thing. I don't suppose you'd mind if I gave the characters more fitting names, yes?
Have we yet to figure out how to go about this final confrontation?

attributes.content: Loughshinny, why are you hiding in your room at dinnertime again?
attributes.name: Cold Young Dragon

attributes.content: Is Dad angry?
attributes.name: Warm Young Dragon

attributes.content: No, but he will be soon.
attributes.name: Cold Young Dragon

attributes.content: I'll be down soon—
attributes.name: Warm Young Dragon

attributes.content: What's that on your desk?
attributes.name: Cold Young Dragon

attributes.content: Nothing!
attributes.name: Warm Young Dragon

attributes.content: The young red dragon tries to block her sister's line of sight with her body, but her effort is in vain.
A small paper box sits on her desk, carefully lined with cotton. Inside lies a tiny fowlbeast—already dead but still harboring a faint lingering warmth.
It seems to have broken its leg while alive. An unsuccessful splint fashioned from stiff paper now lies in pieces around it, accompanied by a few grains of wheat.
This is the fowlbeast that sang at my window every morning. I don't know what happened to it, but... I wanted to save it, and...
attributes.name: Warm Young Dragon

attributes.content: I beg of you, Sister—Tell Dad I'm only feeling ill. I'll be on time for dinner tomorrow... I'll bury it in the courtyard tonight.
attributes.name: Warm Young Dragon

attributes.content: So you're giving up?
attributes.name: Cold Young Dragon

attributes.content: It's already dead.
attributes.name: Warm Young Dragon

attributes.content: Is that so?
attributes.name: Cold Young Dragon

attributes.content: Purple flames slip past the fowlbeast's feathers into its already cold body.
The two watch as it slowly stands up, its broken leg stiffly propping itself up on the cotton.
Alright. Would you like it to fly, or to sing a song for you?
attributes.name: Cold Young Dragon

attributes.content: N-No! This isn't right! Not like this!
attributes.name: Warm Young Dragon

attributes.content: Then why didn't you use your own flames on it while it was still alive?
attributes.name: Cold Young Dragon

attributes.content: Your fowlbeast could have lived a much longer life. You do realize you aren't limited to how the mediocre masses do things, don't you?
attributes.name: Cold Young Dragon

attributes.content: But Mum told me to swallow my flames, hide them away, and never let them be seen...
attributes.name: Warm Young Dragon

attributes.content: And who would see them in your own room?
attributes.name: Cold Young Dragon

attributes.content: The young dragon looks away to avoid her sister's eyes, but finds her gaze landing on the fowlbeast standing on its cotton bed instead.
Purple fire burns in its eyes, and even the way it tilts its head is the spitting image of her sister.

attributes.text: Or do we perhaps still harbor unrealistic fantasies for how this could end?

attributes.content: Sister, you're covered in blood... were you injured?!
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: Most of it isn't mine. The Duke's spy bled profusely.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: I'll replace your bandages.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: Where is the Earl of Warwick?
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: He has... work to do.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: Yes, so he says. And as always, you take him at his word.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: He even allowed the spy to discuss poetry with you while he 'works'.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: I thought I'd been keeping mum about our origins, as well as anything related to the Earl's vision...
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: Everyone in this manor knows you never say a word more than necessary. That has never been something the Earl would bother to check.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: That's right. Had we let the spy escape, the Earl would still inevitably find a way to silence him in the dark, and we'd simply find ourselves bound by yet another chain called caution.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: I'm sorry, I—
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: There's no need for you to apologize. Apologies have never changed a thing.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: Once packed with guests, the long-empty parlor's acoustics now amplify the sound of the bandages being ripped apart, making the atmosphere even heavier.
Those poems by that Seamus Williams you've been so into... If you can remember them, why not recite a line or two for me?
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: The noble red dragon racks her brains for a verse that would not rouse her sister's rage. Perhaps something related to Tara, brave warriors, or even ancient legends—
But all she can recall are verses that stand aloof from worldly affairs.
'The land is but a strange romance, the cause of its end lost to chance ill.'
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: 'I am but a wandering bard, well-versed in lore from songs in the woods...'
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: She sneaks a peek at her sister's face and sees no change, so she plucks up her courage and continues to recite more lines.
Only when she finishes both the entire poem and the new bandage with a delicate knot does she realize that her sister has already fallen asleep, encircled by meter and rhyme.
Sister.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: Ah, Loughshinny. You've kept me waiting.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: What of your new friends? The wayward wakewoman, or perhaps that lively nomad?
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: With your presence, any obstacles preventing you from bringing them along should have easily been reduced to naught.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: They're in the city, but this is a moment to be shared by us alone.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: Indeed.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: It's cold out here on the balcony, so let us continue this in the corridor.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: A replica of where Labhréathach died, in Na Saoirsí... Why must you cling onto our inglorious history and repeat it?
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: I see you've gained a deeper understanding of the word Tara.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: But if history does not repeat itself, then how can we speak of breaking the cycle?
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.text: It can be very difficult to tell us apart by appearance.
But the moment either of us speaks, it becomes as clear as night and day.
Eblana only ever steers the conversation toward her own interests, while Loughshinny is ever the polite one.
She'd get to the bottom of this and find an ending—
Don't interrupt me, sir. I'm talking about the characters in the story.

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Eblana.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: No, I'm quite glad. You finally accepted my invitation.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: To dance?
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: Yes. To dance.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: I'll dance with you to the end, together. However...
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: Please tell me first. The last time we met, you said you couldn't afford to wait any longer... What exactly is going on?
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: With that same smile of hers, the older sister stands at the end of the corridor, while the younger clutches her hands together and hides in the shadow of a wall lamp, hoping the other party won't notice her heart wavering.
Poor thing. She could have concluded this farewell so much sooner.
You've become... frail.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: The flames of death must have their limits. Spreading them so far would certainly drag you down as fire after fire blooms, just like Labhréathach back then... Am I right?
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: I see. While that ghost's fire might resemble mine, his temperament is closer to yours. It seems he's helped you quite a lot.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: At first he only wanted to watch all of Tara burn.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: He was simply trying to keep it together...
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: Just like you.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: The noble red dragon finally steps out of the shadows, walking forward to support her sister who seems on the verge of being unable to stand... just like before.
Is that so?
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: At last you resemble your younger self, when you knew nothing of flames or fate. The you who tried to shield me.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: It has been a truly long time, Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: I remember. It was when Mrs. Murphy next door passed away. You didn't like her, but fancied the beautiful bouquet of flowers in her coffin...
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: So you used your flames to change her body's position.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: I saw scorch marks on the flowers and thought you'd be scolded, so I told our parents I was the one who did it. I even fabricated a story of how I opened and closed the coffin...
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: And so you were scolded instead.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: How could poor Mum and Dad—who couldn't even hide the flames in that family in time—possibly have noticed the faint scorch marks on some flowers?
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: ...Indeed.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: Is that why you've always been cowering?
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: Would you blame every decision you've made in life on one unfortunate childhood experience?
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: ...Hah.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: So tell me, Sister. Tell me there's still time.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: I'll accompany you out of the citadel and into the square. Have the people return their flames to you.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: I'll walk through Tara's fields with you, and gather the dead you've intentionally or unintentionally awoken with your Arts, sending them all to a peaceful rest.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: I'll recite poems to you while you're weak, until you fall asleep and wake up again.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: There's still time for all of that, yes?
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: I trust you to keep your word. Your noble nature would be appalled at the very thought of breaking a promise.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: But what you just described, would that truly make you happy?
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: Or would that simply be enough to appease the Loughshinny Dublinn who did not even witness her parents' death, that snowy night? Those... beautiful fictions?
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: Sister. Love, poetry, dreams—those are all well and good, but it is time for you to wake up.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: Kill me. If you truly wish to end this chaos, that is the only way.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: Then, put on the crown, and you shall become me, while I become you.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: That is the one thing I cannot do.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: You'll have time to mull over it once I'm dead.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: Didn't you decide not to hesitate anymore, Loughshinny?
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: There's been no other choice for us from the moment you came back to see me.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: The older sister's mouth curls up in an intriguing arc.
Come, dance with me.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: Is this... the dance you've been looking forward to all this time?
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: Why can't it be?
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: The younger sister closes her eyes as she points her spear at her older sister, whose body is about to topple over. She grips her weapon with both hands.
The sharp speartip pierces the red dragon's body, but she stands unmoved, as if nothing happened at all, until her younger sister's hand circles her waist, and her body slowly crumples.
...Just like the end of a dance.
Yes, I know.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: I should have known long ago.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: But why? Why must it be now?
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: ...Then when?
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: Don't tell me you'd prefer to stab my heart on a fine afternoon, after meticulously dissecting every nuance of right and wrong with me?
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: You returned to me, and we danced this dance together. That's enough.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: I only thought... if my sorrow and hatred were thrown into a suitable flame, they'd eventually become the fuel for life to go on.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: Sorrow, and hatred... so you admit it, Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: Your noble virtues have only hurt you in the end. Where is your fire, Sister?
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: I can't put out your flames just like that.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: Hah, you mean... the people in the city?
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: You will die, but not now. Your flames will be extinguished at your funeral, at your fire-returning ceremony.
attributes.name: Noble Red Dragon

attributes.content: But still, you ought to be dispelling death with scorching flames, rather than holding the hand of the dead and confessing your own inner turmoil, your own regrets. Otherwise...
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: You will only ever be as you are now, letting go of your chance to save everything... your final chance.
attributes.name: Greedy Red Dragon

attributes.content: The noble red dragon loosens her grip in shock, and her sister's body drops to the ground, as cold as it was before her heart was pierced.
It is not blood but purple fire that roars from the wound spanning her entire torso. It instantly floods the balcony and flows down the citadel.
The noble red dragon rushes over to the balcony, but the purple flames of death are even faster.
Before her own flames can emit even the tiniest spark of light, the purple fire spreads across the city, burning the whole of Na Saoirsí.
The last time she looked out from this very spot, the flames were scattered like stars in the sky. When she had returned earlier that day, they coated the whole city with a cold and gloomy hue.
And now...
Na Saoirsí itself burns fiercely, just like every other restless corpse she has seen.
